headline.main: Chris Davis’s Deal With Orioles Keeps Yoenis Cespedes in Play for Mets

multimedia.caption: Chris Davis reportedly agreed to a seven-year deal with the Orioles.
Chris Davis reportedly agreed to a seven-year deal with the Orioles.
Chris Davis reportedly agreed to a seven-year deal with the Orioles.
Chris Davis reportedly agreed to a seven-year deal with the Orioles.

saves.lead_paragraph: The agreement to sign Davis, who accepted a seven-year, $161 million deal, may mean Cespedes, another free agent Baltimore courted, would take a short-term contract with New York.

saves.snippet: Why is Beijing using brute force to close down a tiny publisher of two-bit political gossip?
saves.lead_paragraph: Why is Beijing using brute force to close down a tiny publisher of two-bit political gossip?
saves.abstract: Op-Ed article by journalist Lian Yi-Zheng proposes alleged abduction of associates at politically provocative Hong Kong publishing house could be product of rivalry within Chinese Communist Party leadership; suggests blatant violation of Hong Kong's autonomy for seemingly facile reason reflects party's faltering political judgement.

saves.snippet: Markets in the United States closed down by more than 2 percent after trading was halted in China for the second time this week.
saves.lead_paragraph: Markets in the United States closed down by more than 2 percent after trading was halted in China for the second time this week.
saves.abstract: Chinese officials are forced to halt stock trading for second time in week after Chinese stocks plunge over 7 percent after only 29 minutes of trading; renminbi continues to be sore spot, and question remains about whether market turmoil is due to rule changes within Chinese Stock market or to broader economic fundamentals and slowdown of Chinese economy.

headline.main: Stock Markets Shudder After Chinese Stock Plunge Forces a Trading Halt
headline.print_headline: China Halts Trading as Stocks Tumble 7 Percent in 29 Minutes

byline.contributor: Nathaniel Popper contributed reporting from New York, and David Jolly from Paris.
byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and AMIE TSANG

headline.main: Review: Passions Ignite in ‘Lives of Reason’ at Two River Theater

multimedia.caption: From left: Peter Rini (Matthew Livingston), Matthew Lieff Christian (Jeffrey Cabot), Mairin Lee (Ilona Cabot), Maurice Jones (Carl Cooper) and Philip Goodwin (Sam DeLuca) in “Lives of Reason” at Two River Theater.

From left: Peter Rini (Matthew Livingston), Matthew Lieff Christian (Jeffrey Cabot), Mairin Lee (Ilona Cabot), Maurice Jones (Carl Cooper) and Philip Goodwin (Sam DeLuca) in “Lives of Reason” at Two River Theater.

From left: Peter Rini (Matthew Livingston), Matthew Lieff Christian (Jeffrey Cabot), Mairin Lee (Ilona Cabot), Maurice Jones (Carl Cooper) and Philip Goodwin (Sam DeLuca) in “Lives of Reason” at Two River Theater.

From left: Peter Rini (Matthew Livingston), Matthew Lieff Christian (Jeffrey Cabot), Mairin Lee (Ilona Cabot), Maurice Jones (Carl Cooper) and Philip Goodwin (Sam DeLuca) in “Lives of Reason” at Two River Theater.

saves.lead_paragraph: In “Lives of Reason,” a play by Robert Rechnitz and Kenneth Stunkel having its world premiere in Red Bank, several academics compete for a deanship .

headline.main: As Frustrations With Mexico’s Government Rise, So Do Lynchings

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and PAULINA VILLEGAS

multimedia.caption: A truck on fire near the place where two men were lynched and burned to death by an angry crowd in the main square of Ajalpan in October.
A truck on fire near the place where two men were lynched and burned to death by an angry crowd in the main square of Ajalpan in October.
A truck on fire near the place where two men were lynched and burned to death by an angry crowd in the main square of Ajalpan in October.
A truck on fire near the place where two men were lynched and burned to death by an angry crowd in the main square of Ajalpan in October.

saves.lead_paragraph: The actions are born of a sense of hopelessness and impotence in the country, where 98 percent of murders go unsolved and many crimes are not even reported.

headline.main: At Lemaire, Tailoring With a Sense of Ease

saves.lead_paragraph: The fall/winter 2016 men’s show drew inspiration from portraits of craftsmen and workers in the early 1900s.
